#%linkopens#This link opens in a new browser window, browser tab or is downloaded, depending on your setting.#Ce lien s'ouvre dans une nouvelle fenêtre, onglet du navigateur ou est téléchargé, selon vos réglages.
#%wcag-instrtitle#Instructions: Keyboard Navigation#Instruction: Naviguer dans la carte à l'aide du clavier
#%wcag-instrtitlealt#Instructions: Keyboard Navigation - Help#Instruction: Naviguer dans la carte à l'aide du clavier - aide

#%wcag-instr#Keyboard user: When the map is in focus, use the arrow keys to pan the map and the plus and minus keys to zoom. Setup your keyboard to control the mouse or enable the accessibility mode to have coordinates input box.#Utilisateur du clavier : Lorsque la carte a l'attention, utiliser les touches flèches pour déplacer la carte et utiliser les touches plus et négatif pour faire un zoom. Configurer votre clavier pour contrôler la souris ou activer le mode accessibilité afin d'avoir les boîte d'entrée pour les coordonnées.
#%wcag-title#Accessibility mode coordinates input#Entré des corrdonnées en mode accessibilité
#%wcag-msgx#Value needs to be between 50 and 130#la valeur doit être entre 50 et 130
#%wcag-msgy#Value needs to be between 40 and 80#la valeur doit être entre 40 et 80

#%toolbarnav-inskeyboard#When entering a geographic location suggested names will appear in the auto-fill list below the text entry box. Suggestions will start appearing after you type 3 characters.#Lorsque vous spécifiez un lieu géographique des suggestions apparaissent dans la liste d'auto-remplissage en dessous de la zone de texte. Les suggestions commenceront à apparaître après avoir tapé 3 caractères.

#%toolbardata-err1#There must be a field (latitude, lat, y or ycenter) for y coordinnates and a field (longitude, long, x or xcenter) for x coordinnates.#Il doit y avoir un champ (latitude, lat, y ou ycenter) pour les coordonnées y et un champ (longitude, longue, x ou xcenter) pour les coordonnées x.
#%toolbardata-err2#Unable to determine the separator.#Incapable de déterminer le separateur.
#%toolbardata-err3#Error fetching items from CSV store: #Erreur de récupération des items du fichier CSV:

#%toolbardata-ie9#This tool is not available in Internet Explorer 9. You need version 10 or another browser (Chrome, FireFox or Safari).#Cet outil n'est pas disponible dans Internet Explorer 9. Vous devez avoir la version 10 ou un autre navigateur (Chrome, Firefox ou Safari).
#%inset-tplight#Open the content in a lightbox#Ouvrir le contenu dans un lightbox
#%mp-error#The image could not be loaded.#L'image ne peut être chargée.
#%help-overview-desc1#The GeoCanViz Viewer is a tool to help you find, explore and understand spatial data using a graphical user interface.#

#%help-overview-desc2#The GeoCanViz Viewer can be configured to use some or all of the tools and toolbars depending on the needs of the content of the map. For this reason, some of the tools described in this help document may not be available for the map you are currently viewing.#
#%help-key-fn#TAB key will advances the focus to the next element.#
#%help-key-fp#SHIFT+TAB keys will return the focus to the previous element.#
#%help-key-zoom#+/- or CTRL+/CTRL- keys will zoom in/out on the map. The focus must be on the map.#
#%help-key-pan#LEFT ARROW, RIGHT ARROW, UP ARROW, DOWN ARROW keys will pan around the map (moves the map sideways or up/down). The focus must be on the map.#
#%help-key-enter#ENTER key will selects the element which currently has the focus.#
#%help-key-space#When the focus is on an expander icon, the SPACE BAR key will expand the toolbar and SPACE BAR key again will close it.#
#%help-key-wcag#You can enable the accessibility mode by checking the enable accessibility mode check box in the -Instructions: Map navigation- drop down section at the top of the map.#
#%help-map-zoom#Click the Full Extent tool to zoom the map to its full (national) extent.#

#%help-map-zoombar#Use the Zoom Bar tool to change the zoom level of the map.  The red colour indicates the zoom level of the map and to change it, click the bar above the red colour to zoom in and below the level of the red colour to zoom out.#
#%help-head-about#Click to open a window containing a description of the map.#
#%help-head-print#Click to print the current view of the map.#
#%help-head-exfs#Click to return to the default map size.#
#%help-head-menu#Toggle to open and close all the available toolbars#
#%help-foot-scalebar#The map scale bar shows the length of the indicated distance on the map. Note: the distance is approximate#
#%help-foot-coord#The coordinates shown are the latitude and longitude of the mouse cursor location.#

#%help-foot-arrow#This north arrow shows the direction of geographic north also known as the North Pole. This direction will change depending on the geographic area shown in the map window and the map’s projection.#
#%help-draw-title#Measuring and Drawing Tools#Mesures et outils de dessin
#%help-draw-colorselect#The colour selector is used to select a colour for measured paths and areas, drawn lines and added text.#
#%help-draw-line#Use the pencil tool to draw lines on the map:#
#%help-draw-line1#1. Click the pencil tool, the menu will then close.#
#%help-draw-line2#2. Click on the map, keeping the left mouse button depressed#
#%help-draw-line4#4. When finished, release the left mouse button.#
#%help-draw-line5#5. When finished, press the “Esc” key on your keyboard or click the Menu title.#
#%help-draw-text#Use the text tool to add text to the map:#
#%help-draw-text1#1. Click the text tool, the menu will then close.#
#%help-draw-text2#2. An “Add Text” dialogue box will appear, enter the text and click “Ok”.#
#%help-draw-text3#3. The dialogue box will be replaced with a “target” shaped cursor.#
#%help-draw-text4#4. Click on the map were the text should be placed.#
#%help-draw-text5#5. The dialogue box will reappear, repeat steps 2 to 4 to enter more text or click “Cancel” to finish.#
#%help-draw-length#Use the Measure a Path tool to measure single or multiple connected distances on the map (it is possible to measure many separate distances).#
#%help-draw-length1#1. Click the Measure a Path tool, the menu will then close.#
#%help-draw-length2#2. Click the start location on the map.#

#%help-draw-length3#3. If a single path is measured, either double click the second location on the map or single click the second location followed by pressing the “Esc” key on your keyboard and the total length will be shown.#

#%help-draw-length4#4. If multiple connected paths are measured, click all locations on the map ensuring the last location is either a double click or a single click followed by pressing the “Esc” key on your keyboard. The total distance will be displayed.#
#%help-draw-length5#5. When finished, press the “Escape” key on your keyboard or click the Menu title and the menu will reopen.#
#%help-draw-lengtherase#* To erase one or all measured distances, click the Menu title and use the Erase All or Erase Selected tools.#
#%help-draw-area#Use the Measure an Area tool to measure areas on the map (it is possible to measure many separate areas).#
#%help-draw-area1#1. Click the Measure an Area tool, the menu will then close.#
#%help-draw-area2#2. Click the start location on the map.#
#%help-draw-area3#3. Click three or more other locations on the map to create a polygon.#

#%help-draw-area4#4. When the polygon on the map covers the desired area, either double click the final location or single click it, followed by pressing the “Esc” key on your keyboard. The area will be shown.#
#%help-draw-area5#5. When finished, press the “Escape” key on your keyboard or click the Menu title and the menu will reopen.#
#%help-draw-areaerase#* To erase one or all measured areas, click the Menu title and use the Erase All or Erase Selected tools.#
#%help-draw-eraseall#Click the Erase All tool to erase all lines, text and distances on the map.#
#%help-draw-eraseselect#Click the Erase Selected tool to erase selected lines, text and distances on the map.#
#%help-draw-eraseselect1#1. Click the Erase Selected tool, the menu will then close.#
#%help-draw-eraseselect2#2. Click on the map, keeping the left mouse button depressed and draw a polygon over the feature(s) to be erased.#
#%help-draw-eraseselect3#3. Release the left mouse button and the feature(s) will disappear.#
#%help-draw-eraseselect4#4. When finished, press the “Escape” key on your keyboard or click the Menu title and the menu will reopen.#
#%help-draw-undo#Use the Undo tool to undo past actions such as adding lines, text and distance measurements,#
#%help-draw-redo#Use the Redo tool to redo actions such as adding lines, text and distance measurements after they have been deleted,#
#%help-draw-import#Use the Import File tool to import a file that contains drawings that were previously saved. This file must be in JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) format.#
#%help-draw-export#Export the drawings on the map to a file in JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) format, ready for import.#
#%help-nav-title#Search and Map Information#Recherche et information sur la carte
#%help-nav-zoomto#Use this tool to search, then zoom to, a geographic location:#
#%help-nav-zoomto1#1. Enter a geographic name, such as a province, town, lake, river, National Topographic System map number or postal code, in the text box.#
#%help-nav-zoomto2#2. A drop down list will then appear containing choices from the Canadian Geographical Names Database (http://www.nrcan.gc.ca/earth-sciences/geography/place-names/10786).#
#%help-nav-zoomto3#3. Select one of the names by clicking it.#
#%help-nav-zoomto4#4. The map will then zoom to the selected place.#

#%help-nav-pos#Use the Map Information tool to get information about a specific location on the map. This includes the geographic and UTM co-ordinates, National Topographic System (NTS) map number and elevation.#
#%help-nav-pos1#1. Click the Get Coordinates Information tool, the menu will then close.#
#%help-nav-pos2#2. Click the desired location on the map.#
#%help-nav-pos3#3. A pop-up window will appear showing the map information.#
#%help-nav-pos4#4. When finished, click “Ok” or press the “Escape” key on your keyboard it will close the window.#
#%help-nav-pos5#5. Repeat steps 2 to 4 to have information on another location or press the “Esc” key on your keyboard or click the Menu title to finish.#

#%help-nav-ov#The Overview Map Window shows a red rectangle identifying your current map extent in a regional context. You can click, hold and drag this rectangle to quickly pan to a different location.#
#%help-nav-scale#The map scale number indicates the relationship or ratio between a distance on the map and the same distance on the ground. Note: the distance is approximate.#
#%help-leg-title#Map Layers and Legend(s)#Couvertures de la carte et légende(s)

#%help-leg-desc1#This panel shows the map’s layers and offers access to the legend. The layers are grouped into Theme(s), on the top, and Bases(s) on the bottom. Themes and bases can be both individual layers and multi-layered maps. Please see the map description for more information.#
#%help-leg-desc2#When only one layer can be viewed at a time, click the “radio button” on the left side of each layer’s row.#
#%help-leg-desc3#When more than one layer can be viewed at a time, click a “check box” to turn it on or off.#
#%help-leg-slider#The slider, to the left of the layer name can be used to change the opacity. All the way to the left is less opaque and all the way to the right is most opaque.#

#%help-leg-exp#To view a legend, click the black triangle, pointing right on the left end of the layer. It will then point down and change to red. Depending how the layers are structured, it may be necessary to click more than one black triangle to view the legend.#
#%help-data-add#Use the Import a Comma Separated Values (CSV) File tool to import a file that contains geolocation information and display it on the map.#
#%help-data-sample#This is an example of a loaded csv file. You have a visibility checkbox and the symbology use to render the layer.
#%help-data-remove#Button to remove the loaded data layer.#
#%help-dev-logoalt#Get GeoCanViz on GitHub#Obtenir GéoCanViz de GitHub
#%help-dev-logo#Click to open the GeoCanViz developement page on GitHub. You will have access to the latest code version.
